page.title: 06The Longshaw Estate
page.content: The Sheepdog Trials this year were held on September 5th, 6th, and 7th, and were the 87th trials to date, being held on Longshaw Pastures, just in front of the Lodge. Admission was Â£1 for adults, 50p for pensioners and children. The first Trials were held in 1898 and it is said that a challenge for the best shepherding by a Sheepdog was instigated by rivals at the Fox House Inn. Due to poor weather, this was postponed until the summer, and has become a famous and popular event over the ensuing years. The Trials comprise of various dog classed which require the farmer to send his dog off on the outrun towards a group of 3 or 4 sheep at the bottom of the field which may be 400 yards away.
